... oh giver of (everything), good people praise you, in all places. Indeed, you are going to be an (almsgiver) to everyone.

This fragment contains part of the first act of the Maitreyasamitināṭaka; the text here more or less continues on . The Uy. parallel is MaitrHami I, 12a1-13a4. The text running from a8 to a7 (= ) has the following Uy. parallels: MaitrHami 1, 12a (end)-13a30 and MaitrSiŋgim, Taf. 117 (+10) v. 12f. (47). See also 193-4.
The translation and the following commentary are basically adapted from 48.
eṃtsālne. The common form is eṃtsālune. The translation adopts the suggestion of 14). This word belongs to the second pāda of a stanza of 4 x 12 (7/5) syllables.
wsā is a complete verbal form: prt. act., 1st sg. of e- “to give”.
eṃtsāl_une: corrected after 281.
nirdhane: cf. MaitrHami 1, 12 a10 ff; the end of this leaf corresponds roughly to MaitrHami 1, 13, recto (for both cf. 18).
yaśodharavilāpaṃ: stanza of 4 x 14 (7/7) syllables.
pällāntarci is to be corrected to pällāntär-ci.
woul dlike to interpret lyutñam as subj. act. 1st sg. See § 414: Konjunktivklasse VII: Suffix AB -ñ-.
niṣpaläntu: the common form is niṣpalntu, see § 140; 111.
niṣpa_l\ntu: corrected after 281.
Cf. : a1. This sheet finds its equivalent also in the Turfan recension of Maitrisimit, see 47, Taf. 117 (+ 10), v. 12.
32 translates: “I intended every wish of all people to be realized”.
puk niṣpalntu is completed according to : a2.

kśāñ: the word doesn’t appear in any known TA text; it is certainly identical in origin with TB kuśāne, pl. nom. kuśāni, obl. kuśāneṃ, see especially . According to the Uy. (cf. 18), it is translated here into “copper coin”. Vide 47, Taf. 117 (+ 10), v. 16f.: “Ich habe nicht (einmal) soviel Besitz wie fünf Kupfer(münzen), wie sollte ich gar imstande sein, fünfhundert yaratmaq zu geben!” [I do not (even) possess as much as five copper (coins), how should I be able to give five hundred yaratmaq].
yutkont akmalyo is completed according to : a3. The word a(kmalyo) is restored by . For pare lutässi, compare line a6: lyutñam pare.
For the forst part of the line, cf. : a4. Vide 48, Taf. 11, r. 2f.
For the middle part of this line, cf. 12): träṅkäm\ is wrong; the virāma is not there in the manuscript.

For the first part of this line, cf. : a5. naṣñi: the Uyghur text has apparently “copper” coin. Vide : Taf. 11, r. 12, p. 48: “Ich habe nicht (einmal) so viel Besitz wie ein Kupferstück.” [I do not (even) possess as much as a copper piece.]
träṅkäṣ is completed according to : a6.
kuro mok: the Uyghur text seems to be a little different, cf. : Taf. 11, r. 15-16, p. 48: “O törichter und unwissender Brahmane” [Oh foolish and ignorant Brahmin].
36 translates: “if you give me (the money), then it is good and I will fulfil your great wishes”.

Since there is a trace of the first syllable, ///lskes may be completed to pälskes, which is the gen. sg. of pältsäk. The meaning of kalam is not clear. Due to a gap in the Uy. 48 find themselves unable to venture a guess.
samakkorrenaṃ: stanza of 20 (5/5/5/5) + 22 (8/7/7) + 10 (5/5) + 15 (8/7) syllables. For the following part, cf. : a7. The interpretation of āriñc wākaläṃ (cf. : b1: (āri) [ñcä\] wākaläṃ) is doubtful.

okäm is not clear. In § 83, Anm. we find no interpretation. 86 translate it to “Vorsicht?” [Watch out]. This seems to be correct. The Uy. here is different from Tocharian, it can in no way help to solve this problem. we pi pkäl is completed according to : b1. Cf. MaitrHami 1, 13 a1-3 (cf. 18).
